metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15746 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
qemu-seccomp.c in QEMU might allow local OS guest users to cause a denial of service (guest crash) by leveraging mishandling of the seccomp policy for threads other than the main thread.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15746` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> we will not be fixing this issue on trusty and xenial. trust lacks a recent kernel and seccomp version and xenial uses a whitelist based approach instead of a blacklist. Fixing this in xenial is likely to cause regressions.

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.6').
